body:
I'm certain this didn't happen on startup. I don't think it crashed prior
to handling any requests, although I'm not completely certain. I believe
that the http server keeps the connection alive and accepts subsequent
requests on the same connection, which might explain the low goroutine
number.

What I had been doing yesterday when this struck was working on this
server, trying out various things, making changes to the code and bouncing
the server to try again. When I said it been up a while, I meant it did not
crash immediately.

Unfortunately (for this bug), I haven't seen the crash since.

-Dan

On Tue, Jan 13, 2015 at 8:59 AM, Dmitry Vyukov <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> It had been running for a while.
>
> Are you sure?
> The crash dump has only two goroutines with ids 1 and 5, so it seems that
> the app has just started and accepted its first connection.
>
> â€”

> <https://github.com/golang/go/issues/9576#issuecomment-69778214>.
